answerText: Anabasis[10] Alexander the Great's campaign in Persia is told in the Anabasis Alexandri, written by this Roman historian of Greek ancestry. He also compiled the Enchiridion of the philosopher Epictetus.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Yale A + Minnesota A | 20 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One character in this work failed to rouse his supporters with speech until a fellow soldier sneezed; emboldened by such a divine omen, the men then made the orator general. For 10 points each: [10] The words "Thalatta! Thalatta!" are spoken upon the seaside arrival of the Ten Thousand Greek mercenaries following Cyrus the Younger in what work by Xenophon?
